posts.post_content:
Ridiculous.  
You know how your [Rakdos Cackler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rakdos Cackler) is just sitting there turn 4, as a worthless card because it can't even chump block at this point? Madcap Skills. 5/2 can only be blocked by 2 or more creatures. Hey, it was pretty useless anyways, so why not 2 for 1?  
4.5/5 absolutely amazing at common.
posts.html:

Posted By: FatalEagle (2/6/2013 5:30:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
In this set there are two common enchantment removals; Angelic Edict and Naturalize. There is one uncommon that can destroy enchantments; Rust Scarab. Two rares, Merciless Eviction and Sylvan Primordial *could* deal with the Skills. So of the 5 direct options, four of them come down a minimum three turns after Madcap. This is a large set, so the chances of even seeing naturalize in a position that you'd want to take it is low. That means that we are left with removal, preferably at instant speed, which it has been noted is rather lacking in this set.   
  
The result is a hasted pyrehart wolf that comes down on turn two and attacks for three. Combine that with the color whose corresponding guilds most want to turn cheap beaters sideways and you have the makings of a Limited house. Each time I've seen this card come down it has gained massive value for its controller. In the early stages you want to develop your board, not hold up removal in fear of a common enchantment. Ho... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
This thing is an absolute nightmare in limited. With the sheer number of unblockable/flying creatures in the block, taking a minimum of 4 every turn hurt.  
  
The worst thing ever for me was being on the receiving end of an [Armored Transport](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armored Transport) who apparently had some Mad Skills because I kept eating 5 to the face, not to mention the guy was running several bloodrush cards.
posts.html:

The worst thing ever for me was being on the receiving end of an Armored Transport who apparently had some Mad Skills because I kept eating 5 to the face, not to mention the guy was running several bloodrush cards.

posts.post_content:
This card is pretty good because a lot of the time it's unblockable. No one wants to trade two monsters for one. It suffers from what makes all enchantments suck, the fact that it can be bounced or otherwise removed.   
  
HOWEVER. It has the most epic flavor text.  
  
If anyone doesn't get it then the card is referencing this guy's ability to herd people together in order for him and his rakdos buddies to slaughter them in one of their weird rakdos blood festival orgy things. Anyway that's why the card can't be blocked by one creature.
posts.html:
